Name: Mbaiki
Description: Mbaiki is the main city in the southern part of the Central African Republic.

Name: Bambari
Description: Bambari Is the third largest city in the Central African Republic, lying on the Ouaka River. It is an important market town and is also home to an airport.

Name: Bangassou
Description: Bangassou is the capital of the Mbomou prefecture in the Central African Republic. Situated on the river Mbomou and at a stones-throw  from the border with the neighbouring Democratic Republic of the Congo, Bangassou has been repeatedly tangled up in rebellion fights, including as recently as 2013.

Name: Birao
Description: Birao is a remote and out of the way place in the very north of the Central African Republic. It is close to the Chad and Sudan border so there is some trade going on but mostly the place suffers from lack of government attention and money.

Name: Bouar
Description: The Central African Republic (French: République centrafricaine or Centrafrique, Sangho: Ködörösêse tî Bêafrîka) is at the geographic center of Africa, bordered by Cameroon to the west, Chad to the north, Sudan and South Sudan to the east, and the Democratic Republic of the Congo and Republic of the Congo to the south.

Name: Dzanga Sangha National Reserve
Description: Dzanga Sangha National Reserve is in Southwest Region of Central African Republic.

Name: Manovo-Gounda St. Floris National Park
Description: This park in the Central African Republic is on the UNESCO World Heritage List.
